member.name: M:IGExtensions.Framework.Tools.GeometryTool.PointsConvexHull(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Windows.Point})
member.summary: Find the convex hull of a point cloud using "Gift-wrap" algorithm
member.remarks:
Runs in O(N*S) time where S is number of sides of resulting polygon. Worst case: point cloud is all vertices of convex polygon: O(N^2). There may be faster algorithms to do this, should you need one - this is just the simplest. You can get O(N log N) expected time if you try, I think, and O(N) if you restrict inputs to simple polygons. Returns null if number of vertices passed is less than 3. Results should be passed through convex decomposition afterwards to ensure that each shape has few enough points to be used in Box2d.
May be buggy with colinear points on hull.
From Eric Jordan's convex decomposition library (box2D rev 32)

member.name: M:IGExtensions.Framework.Tools.MathTool.LinearFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the linear least squares fit y=A+Bx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFitting.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.summary: Creates coefficients for the linear least squares fit y=A+Bx

member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFitting.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.name: T:IGExtensions.Framework.Tools.StackPool`1
member.summary: Represents a pool of reusable objects.

member.name: M:IGExtensions.Framework.Tools.StackPool`1.Pop
member.summary: Gets an object from the pool.
member.remarks: The pool will either Create a new object or Activate one which was previously returned and Deactivated. If DeferDisactivate is set there may be pending active objects available which will be reused directly).

member.name: M:IGExtensions.Framework.Tools.StackPool`1.Push(`0)
member.summary: Returns an object to the pool for recycling.
member.remarks:
All references to objects which have been returned to the pool should be destroyed.
When an object is returned to the pool it will be immediately Deactivated (unless DeferDisactivate is set) and may also be Destroyed either immediately or some time later.

member.name: P:IGExtensions.Framework.Tools.StackPool`1.DeferDisactivate
member.summary: Sets or gets the DeferDisactivate flag.
member.remarks:
When the pool is marked to defer deactivation, objects returned to the pool are not immediately deactivated, instead remaining in a limbo state where they are available for reuse without Activation. Resetting DeferDisactivate causes all of these limbo objects to be deactivated and potentially destroyed.
Deferred deactivation is useful where the activation/deactivation cycle is costly (such as add/remove a VisualElement from a ParentItem Panel).
